instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
no sign of corossion.
with battery charger connected only green light
without battery charger connected got green/orange light.
when press power button fan spins 1sec. 
tried smc bypass can see the apple logo then it shutsdown
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 8.16v
<CHIP>U7100</CHIP>

y5110

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Check voltage and diode mode to ground on SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.
Did you try known good LIO board/flex?

In SMC bypass mode, test the machine with USB macOS.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
SDA is 0.735 3.4v stable
SLC is 0.735 2.8-3.4v pulsing.

LIO board/flex? nothing changes.
it is actually can turn on can go to the menu but it shutsdown itself most of the time when u turn on
fan spins for 1sec. then off again

ppbus with battery only is 8.44v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Test the board alone on the desk; nothing connected, no TP, nor LIO flex, only charger.
Board should start by itself, when charger is plugged in.
Remove SSD and airport card too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
alone on the desk...

same fan spin for 1sec ppbus is 8.19v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Try known good battery.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 8.19V with charger alone, no battery?

Reball SMC; if no change, replace it.
